byline.contributor: Timothy Williams contributed reporting from Chattanooga, Alan Blinder from Atlanta and Matt Apuzzo from Washington. Jack Begg contributed research.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and MANNY FERNANDEZ

abstract: More detailed picture emerges of Mohammod Abdulazeez as investigation continues into his murder of four Marines and a sailor at military base in Chattanooga, Tenn; friends, family members and neighbors detected change in his personality after he returned from trip to Jordan in 2014, noting that troubled man had become increasingly pious, discussing Islam on his blog and social media; Abdulazeez came from respected and accomplished family that nonetheless seemed to be suffering increasing domestic woes and tumult behind closed doors.
lead_paragraph: Those who knew the family of Mohammod Abdulazeez, who the authorities say fatally shot four Marines and a Navy petty officer on Thursday in Chattanooga, Tenn., recalled a family that seemed to fit in. But problems existed out of neighbors’ sight.

headline.main: Family Troubles Before Killings in Chattanooga
headline.print_headline: Family Troubles Before Killings in Chattanooga
